title: URF is SUPPOSED to be broken as hell
body:
I played back when URF was first introduced. You could pick any champ you wanted, without having to rely on RNG to get who you want *cough ARURF sucks cough*

I didn't mind dying to a Morgana who permasnared me, I still laughed my ass off when Evelynn would just machinegun me down, I loved facing the old braindead Soraka who spammed her Q. Why? Because it was just absurd and extremely fun! You could go with things that wasn't good at all in normals, but worked extremely well in URF! 

I've wanted to play AP Ashe for the entire weekend, because it's fun as hell sniping someone down with her ult, but the game haven't given her to me at all. 

URF was all about picking whatever champ you want and test out new things, and just slam your head on the keyboard and spam spells all game. It was FUN! Getting a completely random champ, often a champ you really don't want, and having to play with that champ for around 20 minutes **isn't fun at all.**

Next time, at least give us 10 bans, and allow us to play whatever we want after that. Or better yet, no bans at all! Ultra Rapid Fire is all about chaos, so allow us to have chaos.

The worst part about All Random in general, not just ARURF, is that it's not really random. It just gives you the same champion three times in a row. Maybe even more. That's why I couldn't play it anymore.

Do you know the story of how Apple had to make their music shuffle LESS random because people didn't think it was random enough? Random doesn't mean you'll get every result, it only means that there's a chance for multiple different options to happen. Apple had to rig it to be less random because people could get the same song several times in a row. If you were to flip a coin 10 times in a row and you got Heads every time, would you argue that flipping a coin is not random?

That's what they say. I don't believe it though personally. Everyone who had an iPod or iPhone at the time said that shuffle only played about 7 songs out of 200, and it was always in the same order too. Shuffle was essentially a playlist lmao
